Read the file 2024_CSN_Number_of_Reports_by_Type.csv while skipping the first two metadata rows.
Drop any rows that contain NaN values.
For every report-type column strip out the thousands separator ',' and cast the strings to integers.
Do a row-wise sum of every report-type count, giving the yearly total number of reports.
Compute the share of 'Other' reports for each year by dividing the 'Other' count by the yearly total.
Check whether the maximum value of the percentage is greater than 0.5; if so print 'Yes', otherwise print No.
